title: Supplication for Hajj and Moral Purity
description: A prayer from Imam al-Sadiq (a.s.) recited during the nights of Ramadan, seeking the opportunity for Hajj and protection from sin.

preamble.arabic: روى الكليني في الكافي عن أبي بصير قال: كان الصادق عليه السلام يدعو بهذا الدعاء في شهر رمضان:
preamble.english: Al-Kulayni narrated in Al-Kafi from Abu Basir, who said: Al-Sadiq, peace be upon him, used to offer this supplication during the month of Ramadan:

phrases.arabic: اللهُمَّ انّى بِكَ أَتَوَسَّلُ وَمِنْكَ اطْلُبُ حاجَتى مَنْ طَلَبَ حاجَةً الىَ النَّاسِ فَانّى لا اطْلُبُ حاجَتى الَّا مِنْكَ،
phrases.english: O Allah, I seek recourse through You and from You alone I ask for my need. While others may seek their needs from people, I indeed seek my need from none but You.
phrases.transliteration: Allahumma inni bika atawassalu wa minka atlubu hajati, man talaba hajatan ilan-nasi fa inni la atlubu hajati illa minka.

phrases.arabic: وَحْدَكَ لا شَريكَ لَكَ،
phrases.english: You are One, without partner,
phrases.transliteration: Waḥdaka lā sharīka laka.

phrases.arabic: وَاسْئَلُكَ بِفَضْلِكَ وَرِضْوانِكَ،
phrases.english: And I beseech You by Your grace and Your pleasure,
phrases.transliteration: Wa-as’aluka bi-faḍlika wa-riḍwānika,

phrases.arabic: انْ تُصَلِّىَ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ وَاهْلِ بَيْتِهِ،
phrases.english: That You send blessings upon Muhammad and his Household,
phrases.transliteration: An tuṣalliya ʿalā Muḥammadin wa-ahli baytihi.

phrases.arabic: وَانْ تَجْعَلَ لى فى عامى هذا الى بَيْتِكَ الْحَرامِ سَبيلًا،
phrases.english: And that You grant me, in this year of mine, a way to Your Sacred House.
phrases.transliteration: Wa-an taj‘ala lī fī ‘āmī hādhā ilā baytika-l-ḥarāmi sabīlā,

phrases.arabic: حَجَّةً مَبْرُورَةً،
phrases.english: An accepted and blessed Hajj.
phrases.transliteration: Ḥajjatan mabrūratan,

phrases.arabic: مُتَقَبَّلَةً زاكِيَةً خالِصَةً لَكَ،
phrases.english: Accepted, purified, and sincere unto You,
phrases.transliteration: Mutaqabbalatan zākiyatan khāliṣatan laka,

phrases.arabic: تَقِرُّ بِها عَيْنى وَتَرْفَعُ بِها
phrases.english: Whereby my eye may find comfort and through which You may grant [me] elevation.
phrases.transliteration: Taqirru bihā ʿaynī wa-tarfaʿu bihā

phrases.arabic: دَرَجَتى وَتَرْزُقُنى انْ اغُضَّ بَصَرى وَانْ احْفَظَ فَرْجى وَانْ اكُفَّ بِها عَنْ جَميعِ مَحارِمِكَ،
phrases.english: ...my rank, and grant me that I lower my gaze, guard my chastity, and abstain thereby from all Your prohibitions.
phrases.transliteration: darajatī wa-tarzuqanī an aghuḍḍa baṣarī wa-an aḥfaẓa farjī wa-an akuffa bihā ‘an jamī‘i maḥārimika,

phrases.arabic: حَتّى لايَكُونَ شَىْ ءٌ آثَرَ عِنْدى مِنْ طاعَتِكَ وَخَشْيَتِكَ،
phrases.english: So that nothing may be more favored in my estimation than obedience to You and the fear of You.
phrases.transliteration: Ḥattā lā yakūna shay’un āthara ‘indī min ṭā‘atika wa-khashyatika.

phrases.arabic: وَالْعَمَلِ بِما احْبَبْتَ،
phrases.english: and acting in accordance with that which You love,
phrases.transliteration: wal-ʿamali bimā aḥbabta,

phrases.arabic: وَالتَّرْكِ لِما كَرِهْتَ وَنَهَيْتَ عَنْهُ،
phrases.english: And the abandonment of that which You dislike and have forbidden,
phrases.transliteration: Wat-tarki limā karihta wa nahayta ‘anhu,

phrases.arabic: وَاجْعَلْ ذلِكَ فى يُسْرٍ وَيَسارٍ وَعافِيَةٍ،
phrases.english: And grant that with ease, prosperity, and well-being.
phrases.transliteration: Waj‘al dhālika fī yusrin wa-yasārin wa-‘āfiyah,

phrases.arabic: وَاوْزِعْنى شُكْرَ ما انْعَمْتَ بِهِ عَلَىَّ،
phrases.english: And inspire me to be grateful for the favors You have bestowed upon me,
phrases.transliteration: Wa awzi‘nī shukra mā an‘amta bihī ‘alayya,

phrases.arabic: وَاسْئَلُكَ انْ تَجْعَلَ وَفاتى قَتْلًا فى سَبيلِكَ تَحْتَ رايَةِ نَبِيِّكَ مَعَ اوْلِيآئِكَ،
phrases.english: And I beseech You to grant that my death be as one slain in Your cause, under the banner of Your Prophet, and in the company of Your close servants.
phrases.transliteration: Wa-as’aluka an taj‘ala wafātī qatlan fī sabīlika taḥta rāyati nabiyyika ma‘a awliyā’ika.

phrases.arabic: وَاسْئَلُكَ انْ تَقْتُلَ بى اعْدآئَكَ وَاعْدآءَ رَسُولِكَ،
phrases.english: And I beseech You to slay through me Your enemies and the enemies of Your Messenger.
phrases.transliteration: Wa-as’aluka an taqtula bī a‘dā’aka wa-a‘dā’a rasūlik.

phrases.arabic: وَاسْئَلُكَ انْ تُكْرِمَنى بِهَوانِ مَنْ شِئْتَ مِنْ خَلْقِكَ،
phrases.english: And I beseech You to honor me through the debasement of whomsoever You will from among Your creation.
phrases.transliteration: Wa-as’aluka an tukrimanī bi-hawāni man shi’ta min khalqika.

phrases.arabic: وَلا تُهِنّى بِكَرامَةِ احَدٍ مِنْ اوْلِيآئِكَ،
phrases.english: And do not humiliate me by the honor of any of Your chosen friends,
phrases.transliteration: Wa lā tuhinnī bi karāmati aḥadin min awliyā’ika,

phrases.arabic: اللهُمَّ اجْعَلْ لى مَعَ الرَّسُولِ سَبيلًا،
phrases.english: O Allah, ordain for me a path with the Messenger.
phrases.transliteration: Allahummaj‘al lī ma‘ar-rasūli sabīlā.

phrases.arabic: حَسْبِىَ اللَّهُ ما شآءَ اللَّهُ (1).
phrases.english: Sufficient for me is Allah; whatever Allah wills.
phrases.transliteration: Ḥasbiyallāhu mā shā’allāh (1).
